intro: Henriettea williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' henriettea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer. Henriettea williamsii thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained acidic soil, making it a challenging species to cultivate outside its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and vulnerability to habitat loss, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
